docs.snippet: Journalists from NBC, ABC, CNN and Fox News will moderate the three scheduled debates between U.S. presidential candidates Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump ahead of the Nov. 8 election, the nonpartisan group organizing the events said on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Journalists from NBC, ABC, CNN and Fox News will moderate the three scheduled debates between U.S. presidential candidates Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump ahead of the Nov. 8 election, the nonpartisan group organizing the events said on Friday.

headline.main: Organizers Name TV Journalists to Moderate U.S. Presidential Debates

docs.snippet: It's just a trickle now, but some Republicans are urging people to back GOP congressional candidates because they'd constrain Hillary Clinton's agenda should she be elected president this November....

docs.snippet: Poisoning kids is a partisan issue....
docs.lead_paragraph: Poisoning kids is a partisan issue.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column asserts lead poisoning in American cities is partisan issue; notes lead exposure is strongly tied to growing up in disadvantaged household, and way politicians respond to such social and environmental crises splits along partisan lines; says split over lead pollution reflects even broader stakes facing United States.

docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton said on Friday that if elected to the White House she would create an oversight panel to protect U.S. consumers from large price hikes on long-available, lifesaving drugs and to import alternative treatments if necessary, adding to...
docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton said on Friday that if elected to the White House she would create an oversight panel to protect U.S. consumers from large price hikes on long-available, lifesaving drugs and to import alternative treatments if necessary, adding to her pledges to rein in overall drug prices.

headline.main: Clinton Offers Plan to Curb 'Unjustified' Price Hikes on Life-Saving Drugs
headline.print_headline: Clinton Offers Plan to Curb 'Unjustified' Price Hikes on Life-Saving Drugs

docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton, under questioning by federal investigators over whether she had been briefed on how to preserve government records as she was about to leave the State Department, said she had suffered a concussion, was working part-time and could...
docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton, under questioning by federal investigators over whether she had been briefed on how to preserve government records as she was about to leave the State Department, said she had suffered a concussion, was working part-time and could not recall every briefing she received.

headline.main: Clinton Tells FBI She Could Not Recall All Briefings on Preserving Documents
headline.print_headline: Clinton Tells FBI She Could Not Recall All Briefings on Preserving Documents

docs.snippet: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump has run an unusually cheap campaign in part by not paying at least 10 top staffers, consultants and advisers, some of whom are no longer with the campaign, according to a review...
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump has run an unusually cheap campaign in part by not paying at least 10 top staffers, consultants and advisers, some of whom are no longer with the campaign, according to a review of federal campaign finance filings.

headline.main: One Secret of Trump's Low-Cost Campaign: Free Labor
headline.print_headline: One Secret of Trump's Low-Cost Campaign: Free Labor

docs.snippet: The U.S. trade deficit fell in July as imports declined slightly and exports rose to the highest level in 10 months, a possible sign that global demand for American products is starting to rebound....
